example: // prints the contents of /etc/passwd on the user machine

start_terminal.description: Launches an active terminal. The colour of the terminal will change and show the IP of the connected shell.

example: // uploads system.log from the user machine to the root directory on the remote machine
// downloads system.log from the remote server to the user directory on the user machine
put.description: Upload or download files to/from the local shell to/from a remote shell. Takes the path (`string`) to a file on the shell machine, path to a folder (`string`) on the remote shell machine, and the shell (`Shell`) of the machine to copy the file to. Returns `1` on success, or a `string` (containing an error) on failure.
